授業目的: This course surveys modern Japanese society from the perspective of immigration. Specifically, it examines Chinese migration to Japan from the late Tokugawa years to the present. It discusses politics, economics, social relations, and culture. While grounded in history, this course seeks to elucidate patterns and trends relevant to present-day Japanese society. More broadly, it encourages students to reflect on immigration as a modern global phenomenon.
到達目標: By taking this course, students will gain a general understanding as well as critical insights into Chinese migration to Japan during the past century and half. Through presentations and writing assignments, students will be able to also improve on their skills in historical and social analysis and expository writing.
特記事項:
